description: From Middle English assignement, from Old French assignement.

entries.meaning: The act of assigning; the allocation of a job or a set of tasks.
examples: This flow chart represents the assignment of tasks in our committee.

definitionGroups.group: The categorization of something as belonging to a specific category.

entries.meaning: (LGBT) The categorization of persons as belonging to the male or female sex.

examples: The assignment the department gave him proved to be quite challenging.

entries.meaning: A position to which someone is assigned.
examples: Unbeknownst to Mr Smith, his new assignment was in fact a demotion.

entries.meaning: (education) A task given to students, such as homework or coursework.
examples: Mrs Smith gave out our assignments, and said we had to finish them by Monday.

entries.meaning: (law) A transfer of a right or benefit from one person to another.
examples: The assignment of the lease has not been finalised yet.

entries.meaning: (law) A document that effects this transfer.
examples: Once you receive the assignment in the post, be sure to sign it and send it back as soon as possible.

entries.meaning: (programming) An operation that assigns a value to a variable.
